bibl.title: Report: Work on Mosquito Extinction, by [Henry Rose Carter], [December 1915]

div1.p: [Carter] reports on mosquito eradication efforts, and includes an itemized list of expenses.

div1.head: Report: Work on Mosquito Extinction, by [Henry Rose Carter], [December 1915]
div1.p:
Report of the work on mosquito extinction done by said
(Sanitation Service) office during the month od December 1915.

Breeding places destroyed: Of culex, 2,574; stegomyia,
1,378; anopheles, 103.

Breeding places petrolized: Of culex, 2,393; stegomyia,
3,395; anopheles, 357.

Breeding placed emptied; 5,759; Breeding places destroyed,
3,396; Breeding places petrolized, 4,330.

Notifications of deficiencies, 634; ccomplied, 446;
not complied, 188.
Petroleum used in this work, 3,025 gallons.

Ditches opened by laborers of the Service, 78, ditches
cleaned 25.

Note: The work of petrolization done with the greatest
expenditure of petroleum is as follows:

Little pond, Presbyterian Hospital, petrolized twice,
2 barrels used.
Large pond Bayola, petrolized twice, 11 barrels used.

Little pond Condado St., petrolized twice, 2 barrels
used.

Stop 43/44, twice, 2 1/2 barrels used.
West of Mr. Behn's, once, i barrel used.
Large pond, east of Mr. Behn's, once, 8 barrels used.
Small pond San Jurge St., once, 3 barrels used.
American Railroad yard 3 times, 3 barrels used.
Miramar, twice, 3 barrels used.
Hipodrome (Santurce) twice, 2 barrels used.
American Tobacco Co., Stop 8, twice, 2 barrels used.
Total barrels of petroleum used 40 1/2.

Cost of this work:
Salary of 6 inspectors at $60.00 per month $ 360.00
Salary of 1 inspector at $83.34 per month, 83.34
One clerk, at $75.00 per month for 24 days 62.50
Wages of laborers from Dec. 1-15, 99.37
Wages of laborers from Dec. 16-31, 123.50
Cost of 1,025 gals petroleum used, 326.75
TOTAL. 1,055.46

Note:- There is expendible and non-expendible
material acquired, which has not yet been paid for and there-
fore not included herein.
